results.title: Peter Beales: a celebration of old roses
results.creator_credit: Vivian Russell, Michelle Fox and Vivian Russell Incorporated
results.brief_description: For anyone interested in Old Roses, Peter Beales should be a familiar name as his nursery contains one of the world’s largest collections of Old Roses. In this documentary Peter takes the viewer on a potted history of Old Roses, from Species through to the Teas. He looks at their place in history and their evolution. The process of hybridizing is explained by Peter’s daughter, Amanda Gipp, and we watch the Beales family at the Sandringham and Royal Norfolk Shows. An eleven minute pictorial index of the roses discussed throughout the video is presented following the credits.

results.title: Peter and the wolf: a Prokofiev fantasy, including the Classical symphony Overture on Hebrew themes and the March
results.creator_credit: Roger Law, Steve Bendelack, Christopher Swann, Frances Peters, Joanna Beresford and Spitting Swanns
results.brief_description: Peter and the Wolf is a long-established classic, but never before has it enjoyed such an unusual and exicitng visual treatment. This production features Claudio Abbado, Roy Hudd (as Prokofiev) and members of the Theatre de Complicite, and introduces Henry Feagins as Peter and some fantastic new ‘Spitting Image’ puppets. The result is a delightful visualization of the Russian composer and his universally beloved musical tale. Filled with hilarious caricature, this Prokofiev Fantasy mixes inspired puppetry with live action. Behind it is Sting’s riveting narration and, of course, Prokofiev’s immortal music - the Classical Symphony and Overture on Hebrew Themes as well as Peter and the Wolf - in bravura performances by The Chamber Orchestra of Europe conducted by Claudio Abbado.

results.title: Peter and the wolf (K)
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Disney’s animated version of “Peter and the Wolf” follows several years after his classic film “Fantasia”. Disney continues his use of music and detailed animation with music from Sergei Prokofiev matched to the characters of the story. Each character is introduced at the beginning of the tale with their appropriate musical instrument from the orchestra. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Peter and the wolf
results.brief_description: Using a combination of live action with animation by Chuck Jones, director George Daugherty directs a lively interpretation of the classic symphonic tale “Peter and the Wolf” by Sergei Prokofiev. This affectionate interpretation brings together the classic story of Peter and his band of animal friends; a bird, a cat and duck who outwit the wiley wolf as they set off on an adventure together. This story is interwoven with live characters and brought to life by a real boy named Peter who discovers the power of imagination and the spirit of adventure. Starring Lloyd Bridges as Grandpa, Kirstie Alley as his daughter Annie, Ross Malinger as Peter (whose other film credits include: Sleepless in Seattle, Kindergarten Cop and Little Bigfoot). Other credits include: Narration by Kirstie Allen and Director of animation by Jean Flynn.

results.title: Peter Allen: the boy from Oz
results.creator_credit: Stephen MacLean, Ben Gannon, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Finance Corporation Australia and Gannon TV Productions
results.brief_description: Peter Allen’s tragic death from AIDS, left the music world bereft of one of the most flamboyant and energetic entertainers. His music, particularly the song “I still call Australia home”, touched the hearts of millions. This documentary looks at Peter’s life and includes interviews with well-known celebrities, family and friends, and brings into focus some of the broader social issues associated with his life.

results.title: Peter's chair
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Using Ezra Jack Keats book as a basis, this film tells of the jealousy Peter feels at the arrival of his baby sister and how his world is put to rights again. Good use of music and amusing and entertaining voice-overs.

results.title: Pete's pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery
results.brief_description: Provides comparison between a mechanized piggery and the traditional method of running a piggery, noting the vast improvements in the control of disease and breeding that have come with automation. No other credits.

results.title: Pesticides: friend or foe?
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Bruce Moir and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows the need for great care in the preparation and use of pesticides. A home gardener and a farmer each make many mistakes when spraying. Shows the mistakes, the dangerous results and the correct procedures.

results.title: Pesta
results.brief_description: At the Festival of Malayan Culture there is singing, dancing, art of self-defence, top spinning, kite flying, all ancient and new Malay, Chinese and Indian sports.
